author: Victoria Lambert
title: We should look after our parents in their old age – it's the least we can do
text:
M y friends in Bristol had the right idea. When their brace of elderly widowed mothers were no longer safe living alone, everyone moved into a new family home together. The stairs were not ideal, but both grannies could spend the day certain of a little company , not to mention a lot of kindness and cups of tea.
It would be cock-eyed idealism to suggest that a household of three generations brought together by necessity ran without any emotional hiccups. But at least my friends could sleep at night knowing the family flock had been safely gathered in.
Their setup reminded me of the Bucket family in Charlie and the Chocolate Family; Charlie and his parents share their home with Grandpa George, Grandma Georgina, Grandma Josephine and Grandpa Joe, who curiously all share the same bed, knitting, eating, debating and plotting in equal measures.
The care minister has called for more children to look after their elderly parents Credit: Alamy I f only we were all so family minded. But let’s be blunt....
